H0.text: Xerophytes are plants adapted to very dry environments.

H1.text: Succulents are plants that are adapted to very dry environments.

H2.text: Pores are the term used for plants that are adapted to very dry environments.

H3.text: Sporozoans are plants that are adapted to very dry environments.

A4.text: A xerophyte (from Ancient Greek ξηρός (xērós) 'dry' and φυτόν (phutón) 'plant') is a species of plant that has adaptations to survive in an environment with little liquid water.

A5.text: Cacti and other succulents are commonly found in deserts, where there is little rainfall.
